net.jmatrix.eproperties
Class SubstitutionProcessor

java.lang.Object
  net.jmatrix.eproperties.SubstitutionProcessor

public final class SubstitutionProcessor
extends Object

Static methods used to substitute tokens for values. Note: This class has some very tricky logic supporting 2 types of substitutions (partial and complete), nested tokens (${key.${env}}), and default values. When changing this class you should: a) know what you are doing b) know the desired token substitution syntax and function. c) test extensively with many tokenized properties files. you have been warned. Bemo, 21 July 2009.

Method Detail

processSubstitution

public static final String processSubstitution(String s,
                                               EProperties p)
Public facing method. There are 2 types of substitutions: partial and complete. Complete substitutions are only possible when the value is simply the token. Partial substitutions are string only. Complete substitutions can replace a token with an object - like EProperties or List. Partial Substitution: key="This is a string with a ${token} value" Complete Substitution: key2=${token} The result of a partial substitution is ALWAYS a String. The result of a complete substitution can be any of [ String, EProperties, List ].

completeReplace

private static final Object completeReplace(String s,
                                            EProperties p,
                                            int iter)
This is replacing a complete key - but should work the same as the partial replace if the value returned by the token lookup is a String.
